title: How to Make Ghee

steps.headline: Heat a skillet on medium-low heat.
steps.description: When it becomes hot, add the butter, stirring constantly.

steps.headline: Continue to stir the butter with a wooden spoon until it has melted entirely.
steps.description: This process should take 5 minutes or less.

steps.headline: When the butter is entirely melted and begins to bubble, turn the heat on the burner down just a bit.
steps.description: You don't want the butter to be boiling so vigorously that it spills and spats out of the skillet.

steps.headline: Cook for another 25 to 30 minutes until the milk protein starts separating on both the top and bottom of the pan.
With a fine-mesh sieve, skim the milk protein from the top of the butter.
steps.description: Discard. When you're finished with this step, the only milk protein you should be able to see will be sitting on the bottom.

steps.headline: Turn the burner back up to medium-low and wait for milk protein bits at the bottom of the pan to begin to brown.
steps.description: This should take 5 to 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the burner before the milk protein bits begin to burn.

steps.headline: Allow ghee to cool for approximately 5 minutes.
Strain ghee through cheesecloth on top of a mason jar to remove the toasted milk protein bits.
Store your ghee in a cool area or in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Ghee solidifies a bit at room temperature, and becomes a solid once set in the refrigerator. When solid, it can be used as a spread.
